poem:
Title: "In the Shadow of the Gavel"

In scales of justice, weighty shadows fall,
Upon Gaza's soil, whispers the world's call.
Gatekeepers of power, in Hague's vaulted hall,
Nicaragua's plea unearths a different thrall.
Brutal echoes, of past conflicts maul,
Germany watches, history returns to drawl.
Change is the restless, ubiquitous squall,
In this worldly dance, we're all a moving scrawl.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "The world court will rule on Germany’s support for Israel. That shows how geopolitics has changed | Steve Crawshaw The case brought by Nicaragua against Germany at the international court of justice (ICJ) in The Hague this week is a powerful example of the unprecedented political impact that the Gaza conflict is having around the world. Most obviously, Israel’s continuing assault after the 1,200 brutal murders and about 240 kidnappings by Hamas on 7 October". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
